intro: Cyanea copelandii, commonly known as the Hawaiian bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the island of Oahu in Hawaii. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, clustered flowers during the spring and summer months. Cyanea copelandii is considered a rare and endemic species, facing threats from habitat loss and invasive species.
